The ideas presented in this book do not exist in a vacuum. Many dedicated organizations are already working on critical pieces of the puzzle, from advocating for clinical trial transparency to pioneering new models for drug discovery. This section lists some of the key players whose work aligns with the goal of building a more effective and humane medical research system.

| Organization                                                                             | Primary Focus                          | Key Initiative / Approach                                                                              |
| ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| [AllTrials](https://www.alltrials.net/)                                                  | Clinical Trial Transparency            | Campaigns for mandatory trial registration and result reporting; tracks compliance.                    |
| [Crowdsourcing Cures](https://www.crowdsourcingcures.org/)                               | Patient-Centric Data Analytics         | Provides a platform for individuals to track health data and analyze treatment effectiveness.          |
| [Cures Within Reach](https://www.cureswithinreach.org/)                                  | Drug Repurposing                       | Funds clinical trials to test old drugs for new uses, especially rare diseases.    |
| [Every Cure](https://everycure.org/)                                                     | AI-Driven Drug Repurposing             | Uses AI and a large database to find new uses for existing drugs.     |
| [FasterCures](https://milkeninstitute.org/centers/fastercures)                           | Medical Research System Reform         | An incubator that advocates for policies and systems to accelerate the research-to-treatment pipeline. |
| [Free to Choose Medicine](https://freetochoosemedicine.com/)                             | Expanded Access / Right to Try         | Advocates for a "parallel track" regulatory system for patient access to investigational treatments.   |
| [Goldwater Institute](https://www.goldwaterinstitute.org/right-to-try/)                  | Policy Reform / Right to Try           | A libertarian think tank that spearheaded the state and federal "Right to Try" laws.                   |
| [Institute for Progress](https://progress.institute/)                                    | Technology & Science Policy            | A think tank that publishes research and proposals on modernizing clinical trials and the FDA.         |
| [Open Source Pharma Foundation](https://www.ospfound.org/)                               | Open-Source Drug Discovery             | Applies open-source principles to pharmaceutical R&D, focusing on neglected diseases.                  |
| [OpenTrials](https://opentrials.net/)                                                    | Open Data Infrastructure               | An (inactive) open database project to aggregate and link global clinical trial data.                  |
| [Patient-Led Research Collaborative](https://patientledresearch.com/)                    | Patient-Led Research                   | A research group run by patients that conducts studies on chronic conditions like Long COVID.          |
| [Reagan-Udall Foundation for the FDA](https://reaganudall.org/)                          | FDA Modernization & Regulatory Science | A foundation created by Congress to advance the science and processes of the FDA itself.               |
